dt: {bc}a salt or ester of {d_link|nitric acid|nitric acid}
{bc}sodium nitrate or potassium nitrate used as a fertilizer
{bc}any of several nitric-acid esters of cellulose {bc}{sx|nitrocellulose||}
{bc}a product (such as {d_link|celluloid|celluloid} film) made from cellulose nitrate

dt.t: In the case of the Clark Gable {it}Mutiny on the Bounty{/it} (1935), the {wi}nitrate{/wi} original was destroyed before anyone noticed the transferred soundtrack was out of sync.

shortdef: a salt or ester of nitric acid
sodium nitrate or potassium nitrate used as a fertilizer
any of several nitric-acid esters of cellulose : nitrocellulose; especially : a product (such as celluloid film) made from cellulose nitrate

dt: {bc}the process of adding a {a_link|nitro} group to an organic compound

shortdef: the process of adding a nitro group to an organic compound

dt: {bc}a colorless crystalline salt NH{inf}4{/inf}NO{inf}3{/inf} used in explosives and fertilizers and in veterinary medicine

shortdef: a colorless crystalline salt NH4NO3 used in explosives and fertilizers and in veterinary medicine

dt: {bc}a colorless liquid ester C{inf}5{/inf}H{inf}11{/inf}NO{inf}3{/inf} of amyl alcohol and nitric acid

shortdef: a colorless liquid ester C5H11NO3 of amyl alcohol and nitric acid

dt: {bc}any of several nitric-acid esters of cellulose used especially for making plastics and explosives {bc}{sx|nitrocellulose||}

dt.t: {wi}Cellulose nitrate{/wi} film was introduced in 1887 and was used until about 1950. It is inherently unstable and highly flammable.

shortdef: any of several nitric-acid esters of cellulose used especially for making plastics and explosives : nitrocellulose

dt: {bc}a toxic compound C{inf}2{/inf}H{inf}3{/inf}O{inf}5{/inf}N found especially in smog

shortdef: a toxic compound C2H3O5N found especially in smog

dt: {bc}a crystalline salt KNO{inf}3{/inf} that occurs as a product of nitrification in arable soils, is a strong oxidizer, and is used especially in making gunpowder, as a fertilizer, and in medicine

shortdef: a crystalline salt KNO3 that occurs as a product of nitrification in arable soils, is a strong oxidizer, and is used especially in making gunpowder, as a fertilizer, and in medicine

dt: {bc}an irritant compound AgNO{inf}3{/inf} that in contact with organic matter turns black and is used as a chemical reagent, in photography, and in medicine especially as an antiseptic and caustic

shortdef: an irritant compound AgNO3 that in contact with organic matter turns black and is used as a chemical reagent, in photography, and in medicine especially as an antiseptic and caustic

dt: {bc}a deliquescent crystalline salt NaNO{inf}3{/inf} used as a fertilizer and an oxidizing agent and in curing meat

shortdef: a deliquescent crystalline salt NaNO3 used as a fertilizer and an oxidizing agent and in curing meat
